channel.title: Do you see a problem here?

item.title: Do you see a problem here?
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

Use a staff command, make an interface pop up. However, to suit your needs.

public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; if (playerRights == 3) { c2.sendMessage("Owner "+playerName+" has logged in."); } else if (playerRights == 2){ c2.sendMessage("Server Administrator "+playerName+" has logged in."); } else if (playerRights == 1){ c2.sendMessage(" Moderator "+playerName+" has logged in."); } else if (playerRights == 0){ c2.sendMessage(" "+playerName+" has logged in."); } } } }

Read full topic
item.source: Do you see a problem here?

item.title: Do you see a problem here?
item.dc:creator: @qtst35 qtst35
item.description:
@qtst35 wrote:

its a nice addin so people know when staff log in incase they need help as atm if you dont have the player as a friend you dont know they have loggen in unless you do ::players or look in the quest tab but all that shows is the number of players and not the names or roles.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you see a problem here?

item.title: Do you see a problem here?
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

[quote=“Ryan4965, post:2, topic:445975”]Try this:

public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; if (playerRights == 0) { c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 1) { c2.sendMessage("@blu@[Moderator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 2) { c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Administrator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 3) { c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner/Coder] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 4) { c2.sendMessage("@yel@[DONATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } } } }

I’d love to know why you were using “break;” rather than “}”[/quote]

Because he could be trying using switch statements?

OP: why would you want to do this? all is does is create lag for the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you see a problem here?

item.source: Do you see a problem here?

item.title: Do you see a problem here?
item.dc:creator: @Ryan4965 Ryan4965
item.description:
@Ryan4965 wrote:

Try this:

public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; if (playerRights == 0) { c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 1) { c2.sendMessage("@blu@[Moderator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 2) { c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Administrator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 3) { c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner/Coder] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } if (playerRights == 4) { c2.sendMessage("@yel@[DONATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); } } } }

I’d love to know why you were using “break;” rather than “}”

Read full topic
item.source: Do you see a problem here?

item.title: Do you see a problem here?
item.dc:creator: @qtst35 qtst35
item.description:
@qtst35 wrote:

ok this is a code ive put together for my server.

public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; if (playerRights == 0) { c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; if (playerRights == 1) { c2.sendMessage("@blu@[Moderator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; if (playerRights == 2) { c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Administrator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; if (playerRights == 3) { c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner/Coder] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; if (playerRights == 4) { c2.sendMessage("@yel@[DONATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; } } } }
